metadata.title: CVE-2023-46813 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.5.9, exploitable bylocal users with userspace access to MMIO registers. Incorrect accesschecking in the #VC handler and instruction emulation of the SEV-ESemulation of MMIO accesses could lead to arbitrary write access to kernelmemory (and thus privilege escalation). This depends on a race conditionthrough which userspace can replace an instruction before the #VC handlerreads it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.6.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.6.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.6.0-13.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-13.13').
linux-aws package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-azure package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
